newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai 1996 vehicles, parts exports value rises.
newsitem.headline: Thai 1996 vehicles, parts exports value rises.

text.p: The value of Thai exports of assembled vehicles and parts in 1996 rose 18 percent to 12.89 billion baht ($515.6 million) from 10.89 billion baht in the previous year, an industry association said on Friday.
The export value of cars and car parts in the year was up 78 percent to 6.03 billion baht from 3.38 billion a year ago, the Thai Automobile Industry Association said in a statement.
The value of motorcycles and motorcycle parts exports in 1996 fell 8.7 percent to 6.86 billion baht from 7.51 billion in 1995, the association said.
The total number of passenger cars and commercial vehicles assembled in Thailand during last year was up 4.12 percent to 547,317 against 525,636 in the previous year, it said.
